intro: Waltheria martii, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces edible, sweet-tasting fruits that are often consumed by local communities. Waltheria martii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes in warmer regions.
